DefaultReaderConfiguration.preQueryCheck: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM ThreatLog tl WHERE tl.ID > ?
DefaultReaderConfiguration.queryString: SELECT tl.DateOccurred, tl.ID, tl.PrimaryServer, tl.ClientName, tl.ClientMacAddress, tl.UserName, tl.ScannerReportedName, tl.Virus, tl.ActionTaken, tl.[Name], tl.[Object], tl.Info FROM ThreatLog tl WHERE tl.ID > ? ORDER BY tl.ID

string.toolTipText: Instance name to read from (if the database is on an instance)
Enter the Websense database connection options.
Date and time in milliseconds since epoch

boolean.toolTipText: Enable to account for Database for being in UTC
Enable to account for Daylight Savings Time when appropriate

string.toolTipText: Hostname of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

integer.toolTipText: Port number of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

select.toolTipText: Data routing (normalized alerts to Manager and/or raw data to nDepth)

DefaultReaderConfiguration.preQueryCheck: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM ScanLog sl WHERE sl.ID > ?
DefaultReaderConfiguration.queryString: SELECT sl.DateOccurred, sl.ID, sl.PrimaryServer, sl.ClientName, sl.ClientMacAddress, sl.UserName, sl.ScannerReportedName, sl.[Description], sl.[Status], sl.Scanned, sl.Infected, sl.Cleaned, sl.TaskID, sl.TaskType FROM ScanLog sl WHERE sl.ID > ? ORDER BY sl.ID

DefaultReaderConfiguration.fullDescription: Collects NOD32 5 Threat events from the ESET Remote Administrator SQL database.
DefaultReaderConfiguration.preQueryCheck: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM ThreatLog tl WHERE tl.ID > ?
DefaultReaderConfiguration.queryString: SELECT tl.DateOccurred, tl.ID, c.PolicyPrimaryServer, c.ComputerName, c.MacAddress, tl.UserName, fts.txt, tl.virus, fthat.txt, tl.name, fthto.txt, tl.info FROM ThreatLog tl JOIN client c ON c.ID = tl.ClientID JOIN FTScanner fts ON fts.ID = tl.FTScannerID JOIN FTHActionTaken fthat ON fthat.HASH = tl.FTHActionTakenHash JOIN FTHThreatObject fthto ON fthto.HASH = tl.FTHThreatObjectHASH WHERE tl.ID > ? ORDER BY tl.ID

string.toolTipText: Instance name to read from (if the database is on an instance)
Enter the Websense database connection options.
Date and time in milliseconds since epoch

boolean.toolTipText: Enable to account for Database for being in UTC
Enable to account for Daylight Savings Time when appropriate

string.toolTipText: Hostname of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

integer.toolTipText: Port number of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

select.toolTipText: Data routing (normalized alerts to Manager and/or raw data to nDepth)

DefaultReaderConfiguration.fullDescription: Collects NOD32 5 Scan events from the ESET Remote Administrator SQL database.
DefaultReaderConfiguration.preQueryCheck: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM ScanLog sl WHERE sl.ID > ?
DefaultReaderConfiguration.queryString: SELECT sl.DateOccurred, sl.ID, c.PolicyPrimaryServer, c.ComputerName AS ClientName, c.MacAddress AS ClientMacAddress, sl.UserName, fts.txt AS ScannerReportedName, sl.Description, fthss.txt AS Status, sl.Scanned, sl.Infected, sl.Cleaned, sl.TaskID, sl.TaskType FROM ScanLog sl JOIN client c ON c.ID = sl.ClientID JOIN FTScanner fts ON fts.ID = sl.FTScannerID JOIN FTHScanStatus fthss ON fthss.HASH = FTHScanStatusHASH WHERE sl.ID > ? ORDER BY sl.ID

string.toolTipText: Instance name to read from (if the database is on an instance)
Enter the Websense database connection options.
Date and time in milliseconds since epoch

boolean.toolTipText: Enable to account for Database for being in UTC
Enable to account for Daylight Savings Time when appropriate

string.toolTipText: Hostname of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

integer.toolTipText: Port number of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

select.toolTipText: Data routing (normalized alerts to Manager and/or raw data to nDepth)

DefaultReaderConfiguration.fullDescription: Collects NOD32 5 Event events from the ESET Remote Administrator SQL database.
DefaultReaderConfiguration.preQueryCheck: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM EventLog el WHERE el.ID > ?
DefaultReaderConfiguration.queryString: SELECT el.DateOccurred, el.ID, c.PolicyPrimaryServer, c.ComputerName AS ClientName, c.MacAddress AS ClientMacAddress, el.UserName, ftp.txt AS PluginReportedName, el.EventText, el.AdditionalText, c.ThreatDBVersionNumber, c.ThreatDBVersionDate FROM EventLog el JOIN client c ON c.ID = el.ClientID JOIN FTPlugin ftp ON ftp.ID = el.FTPluginID WHERE el.ID > ? ORDER BY el.ID

string.toolTipText: Instance name to read from (if the database is on an instance)

DefaultReaderConfiguration.fullDescription: Collects NOD32 5 Firewall events from the ESET Remote Administrator SQL database.
DefaultReaderConfiguration.preQueryCheck: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM FirewallLog fl WHERE fl.ID > ?
DefaultReaderConfiguration.queryString: SELECT fl.DateOccurred, fl.ID, c.PolicyPrimaryServer, c.ComputerName, c.MacAddress, fl.UserName, fl.Source, fl.Target, fthfwe.Txt AS FWEvent, fthp.Txt AS Protocol, fl.ClientID, fl.Application, fthfwrn.Txt AS FWRule FROM FirewallLog fl JOIN client c ON c.ID = fl.ClientID JOIN FTHFwEvent fthfwe ON fthfwe.HASH = fl.FTHFwEventHASH JOIN FTHProtocol fthp ON fthp.HASH = fl.FTHProtocolHASH JOIN FTHFwRuleName fthfwrn ON fthfwrn.HASH = fl.FTHFwRuleNameHASH WHERE fl.ID > ? ORDER BY fl.ID

string.toolTipText: Instance name to read from (if the database is on an instance)
Enter the Websense database connection options.
Date and time in milliseconds since epoch

boolean.toolTipText: Enable to account for Database for being in UTC
Enable to account for Daylight Savings Time when appropriate

string.toolTipText: Hostname of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

integer.toolTipText: Port number of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

select.toolTipText: Data routing (normalized alerts to Manager and/or raw data to nDepth)

DefaultReaderConfiguration.fullDescription: Collects NOD32 5 Threat events from the ESET Remote Administrator MS Access database.
DefaultReaderConfiguration.preQueryCheck: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM ThreatLog tl WHERE tl.ID > ?
DefaultReaderConfiguration.queryString: SELECT tl.DateOccurred, tl.ID, c.PolicyPrimaryServer, c.ComputerName, c.MacAddress, tl.UserName, fts.txt, tl.virus, fthat.txt, tl.name, fthto.txt, tl.info FROM (((ThreatLog tl INNER JOIN client AS c ON c.ID = tl.ClientID) INNER JOIN FTScanner AS fts ON fts.ID = tl.FTScannerID) INNER JOIN FTHActionTaken fthat ON fthat.HASH = tl.FTHActionTakenHash) INNER JOIN FTHThreatObject fthto ON fthto.HASH = tl.FTHThreatObjectHASH WHERE tl.ID > ? ORDER BY tl.ID

string.toolTipText: Date and time in milliseconds since epoch
Hostname of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

integer.toolTipText: Port number of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

select.toolTipText: Data routing (normalized alerts to Manager and/or raw data to nDepth)

DefaultReaderConfiguration.fullDescription: Collects NOD32 5 Scan events from the ESET Remote Administrator MS Access database.
DefaultReaderConfiguration.preQueryCheck: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM ScanLog sl WHERE sl.ID > ?
DefaultReaderConfiguration.queryString: SELECT sl.DateOccurred, sl.ID, c.PolicyPrimaryServer, c.ComputerName AS ClientName, c.MacAddress AS ClientMacAddress, sl.UserName, fts.Txt AS ScannerReportedName, sl.Description, fthss.txt AS Status, sl.Scanned, sl.Infected, sl.Cleaned, sl.TaskID, sl.TaskType FROM ((ScanLog sl INNER JOIN client c ON c.ID = sl.ClientID) INNER JOIN FTScanner fts ON fts.ID = sl.FTScannerID) INNER JOIN FTHScanStatus fthss ON fthss.HASH = sl.FTHScanStatusHASH WHERE sl.ID > ? ORDER BY sl.ID

string.toolTipText: Date and time in milliseconds since epoch
Hostname of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

integer.toolTipText: Port number of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

select.toolTipText: Data routing (normalized alerts to Manager and/or raw data to nDepth)

DefaultReaderConfiguration.fullDescription: Collects NOD32 5 Event events from the ESET Remote Administrator MS Access database.
DefaultReaderConfiguration.preQueryCheck: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM EventLog el WHERE el.ID > ?
DefaultReaderConfiguration.queryString: SELECT el.DateOccurred, el.ID, c.PolicyPrimaryServer, c.ComputerName, c.MacAddress, el.UserName, ftp.txt AS PluginReportedName, el.EventText, el.AdditionalText, c.ThreatDBVersionNumber, c.ThreatDBVersionDate FROM (EventLog el INNER JOIN Client c ON c.ID = el.ClientID) INNER JOIN FTPlugin ftp ON ftp.ID = el.FTPluginID WHERE el.ID > ? ORDER BY el.ID

string.toolTipText: Date and time in milliseconds since epoch
Hostname of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

integer.toolTipText: Port number of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

select.toolTipText: Data routing (normalized alerts to Manager and/or raw data to nDepth)

DefaultReaderConfiguration.fullDescription: Collects NOD32 5 Firewall events from the ESET Remote Administrator MS Access database.
DefaultReaderConfiguration.preQueryCheck: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM FirewallLog fl WHERE fl.ID > ?
DefaultReaderConfiguration.queryString: SELECT fl.DateOccurred, fl.ID, c.PolicyPrimaryServer, c.ComputerName, c.MacAddress, fl.UserName, fl.Source, fl.Target, fthfwe.Txt AS FWEvent, fthp.Txt AS Protocol, fl.ClientID, fl.Application, fthfwrn.Txt AS FWRule FROM (((FirewallLog fl INNER JOIN client c ON c.ID = fl.ClientID) INNER JOIN FTHFwEvent fthfwe ON fthfwe.HASH = fl.FTHFwEventHASH) INNER JOIN FTHProtocol fthp ON fthp.HASH = fl.FTHProtocolHASH) INNER JOIN FTHFwRuleName fthfwrn ON fthfwrn.HASH = fl.FTHFwRuleNameHASH WHERE fl.ID > 0 ORDER BY fl.ID

string.toolTipText: Date and time in milliseconds since epoch
Hostname of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

integer.toolTipText: Port number of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

select.toolTipText: Data routing (normalized alerts to Manager and/or raw data to nDepth)

FastPattern.description: SCANLOG, SystemScanInfo
EVENTLOG, ServiceInfo, Downloading antispam engine data files completed successfully
FastPattern.pattern: \tMail server protection\tDownloading antispam engine data files completed successfully

FastPattern.description: EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Communication with the driver failed
EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Error initializing file submission system
EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Error occurred while adjusting Personal firewall integration
FastPattern.pattern: \tAn error has occurred while adjusting Personal firewall integration

FastPattern.description: EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Error writing antispam counters
EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Virus scanner initialization failed
EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Spam filter, Error opening address book
EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Update information is not consistent
EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Update module, An error occurred while downloading update files
FastPattern.pattern: \tUpdate module\tAn error occurred while downloading update files\.

FastPattern.description: EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Update module, Could not connect to server
EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Update module, Download interrupted
EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Update module, File corrupted
EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Update module, File not found on server
EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Update module, General compiler error
EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Update module, Server not found
EVENTLOG, ServiceWarning, Update module, Undocumented serious error
EVENTLOG, SoftwareUpdate, ESET Kernel, The program modules have been updated
FastPattern.pattern: \tESET Kernel\tThe program modules have been updated

FastPattern.description: EVENTLOG, SoftwareUpdate, ESET Kernel, Virus signature database successfully updated to version
FastPattern.pattern: \tESET Kernel\tVirus signature database successfully updated to version

FastPattern.description: EVENTLOG, SoftwareUpdate, Update module, Bad link to update server
EVENTLOG, SoftwareUpdate, Update module, Error downloading file from update server
FastPattern.pattern: \tUpdate module\tError downloading file from update server

FastPattern.description: EVENTLOG, SoftwareUpdate, Mail server protection, Antispam engine rules have been updated
FastPattern.pattern: \tMail server protection\tAntispam engine rules have been updated

FastField.defaultValue: Antispam engine rules have been updated on "$3"

FastPattern.description: EVENTLOG, UserLogonFailure, Invalid Username and/or Password
FIREWALLLOG, UnusualUDPTraffic, FirewallLog 1, Incorrect UDP packet length
FIREWALLLOG, UnusualUDPTraffic, FirewallLog 2, Incorrect IP packet length (UDP)
FIREWALLLOG, UnusualIPTraffic, FirewallLog 3, Incorrect IP packet length (0)
FIREWALLLOG, NamingAccess, FirewallLog 4, DNS cache poisoning
FIREWALLLOG, LinkControlAccess, FirewallLog 5, ARP cache poisoning
FIREWALLLOG, LinkControlTrafficAudit, FirewallLog 6, Identical IP addresses detected
FIREWALLLOG, UnusualProtocol, FirewallLog 7, Unexpected data in protocol
NullAlert, Statistical information was sent to ESET
NullAlert, Update module, (no useful info in message)
InternalNewToolData ScanLog
InternalNewToolData FirewallLog
